channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-15723] Hive should report a warning about missing table/column statistics to user.
item.description:
Many Hive performance issues are due to missing statistics. Either all, table or column statistics are missing. Potentially a new partition has been added and customer forgot to gather stats for that partition.
A simple warning about a table or column missing statistics can be very helpful and makes hive more user friendly. Hive already has this information, its a matter of printing it out.
item.summary: Hive should report a warning about missing table/column statistics to user.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Patch 01. trying to see if it causes any diffs in golden files (shouldn't, session stats warnings are behind off-by-default conf var)

02.patch adds a conf setting hive.cbo.show.warnings (default false) to control the logging of misisng columns and a test case. Missing stats warnings looks like this:

No Stats for default@missing_stats_t1, Columns: value
No Stats for default@missing_stats_t2, Columns: key
No Stats for default@missing_stats_t3, Columns: value

Which is exactly the same output as the missing stats logged (to hive.log) in RelOpHiveTable.updateColStats, as is actually the very same logMsg.
RB https://reviews.apache.org/r/56025/
Instead of using thread locals to store messages, can we just print message right when we know about them at RelOptHiveTable You may get instance of console there via SessionState.getConsole()
Reason to avoid thread-locals is in multi-threaded HS2, we need to be very careful with them otherwise we may have leaks. So, we tend to avoid them unless there is no other way around it.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12849937 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
+1 rusanu you may address pvary review comments on RB while committing the patch.
Sorry, actually fatthumbed on it on my mobile
04.patch with Yetus warnings addressed
pvary Hi Peter, is there an easy way I can run Yetus on a patch locally so I can test it before upload?

rusanu: Currently you would need too many small patches to make it work. It is not committed yet. (See: HIVE-15051)

What you can do is use HIVE-15725, and run the command which runs the yetus checkstyle check:

cd ql
mvn checkstyle:checkstyle -Dcheckstyle.consoleOutput=true -DskipTests -Pitests -Ptest-patch

Yetus found no other error in your patch.

Thanks,
Peter
hive.cbo.show.warnings should be set to to 'true' by default, since the user may not really know if he is missing statistics and may not even look for this setting. I couldn't reopen the bug.
05.patch changes default to true

Pushed addendum patch

Doc note: hive.cbo.show.warnings needs to be documented in the wiki. It could go after the other hive.cbo.xxx parameters:

  • Configuration Properties – hive.cbo.cnf.maxnodes

Added a TODOC2.2 label.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: hive.cbo.show.warnings (default false) is added to control display of cost-based-optimizer compiler warnings, like missing stats.
